name: Gumboy - Crazy Adventuresâ„¢
description: Gumboy has fun and novel gameplay set in a richly imagined world. With simple game controls, Gumboy lets the player bounce, roll, float, and fly through the world. Additionally, Gumboy can change size, shape and material.
minimum_requirements: Windows 2000/XP SP2, 1 GHz Processor, 256 MB System RAM, 32 MB OpenGL 3D Video Card, 50 MB Available hard disk space, DirectX 8.0 or higher Recommended: 1.6 GHz Processor, GeForce 5200 / Radeon 9600 or better video card

reviews.review_text: I really wasn't expecting this game to be good. Now that ive played it I can say,  Its not that bad!  Its has a really nice art style, some cool and unique power-ups, and some pleasant music. HOWEVER.  Its very slow, the controls are very special to say the least and the game itself gets a bit repetetive. 6/10.

For what it is: it's fun.  This is the sort of game you'd probably find on Kongregate or other Flash-hosting websites, but bigger and prettier. It's worth what I paid for it (I believe $2 or so?) as a simple, somewhat challenging little oddity.
Fun game its great for passing time,
No. Some levels are unbeatable and you have to be perfect and move along top of level in dark with no direction. Not worth the dollar I spent on it.

This game was made for children, i could read the entire game design from the second level, and it managed to be WORSE than Nightsky and Gish. Even thought it is more detailed and beautiful than those two, it still feels like it came out of a game template maker or something.  The mouth sound effects the character makes was bad. The movement is too floaty. And it is just bad in general, i do not recommend it.  Nightsky is more challenging, and Gish has more grip and feels better than this. Go buy those instead.
Terribad. I got this for free and want a refund. Thank yaw.
I do not recommend this game to you! very stupid and not recommended!
